intro: Sida castelneana, commonly known as the Castelnean weed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, pale green leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural areas.
